intro: Eriogonum gracile, commonly known as the slender buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and grasslands. It produces tiny, pink to reddish flowers that bloom in the spring. Eriogonum gracile is adapted to arid environments and is often found in areas with well-drained soil.
